responses.rationale: The segment reports a factual event (person tested positive, suffered conjunctivitis).
The segment reports a country's action (imposed restrictions).
The segment expresses an opinion and describes impact.
The segment reports a request for information.
Describes an action being taken ('We are responding to their requests') which is a response measure/capability.
The segment reports a fact (dead birds) and a call for future action/funding, not existing capability.
The segment describes a potential threat and a condition (funding) for mitigation, not existing capability.
Describes actions taken ('have buried hundreds of dead birds') which are response measures/capabilities.
Describes an action taken ('confirmed the H5N1 outbreak after analysing samples') which is a surveillance/detection capability.
The segment describes a threat and reports a fact (dead birds).
The segment comments on the difficulty of surveillance and control, not stating capability itself.
The segment describes a lack of resources/capability.
Describes reliance on funding to pay for services ('Most rely on international funding... to pay for the services') which is a form of capability/resource statement.
The segment describes government priorities, not a specific disease capability.
States the importance of a capability ('Rapid reaction is critical').
Describes the need for resources/staff ('having staff on the ground with the resources... is essential') and mentions securing funds ('who secured temporary funds').
Describes an action taken ('has written to ask... to help fund') which is seeking resources for capability ('surveillance and disposal').
The segment describes the nature of the situation and recommends future action, not existing capability.
Describes actions taken ('has been monitoring', 'digging holes... to bury') which are response measures/capabilities.
The segment reports findings/facts (number of dead birds).
The segment expresses emotion and describes difficulty.
Describes an ongoing action ('Investigators are now trying to establish') which is an investigation/surveillance capability.
Describes a state of preparedness/capability ('we remain vigilant').
Describes a state of preparedness/capability ('we remain vigilant').
Provides advice/recommendations for action ('people should avoid contact', 'should wash their hands') which are public health measures/safeguards.
The segment reports findings/facts (cases found/detected).
The segment reports findings/facts (mammals found to have flu).
The segment reports findings/facts (cases in Scotland).
The segment expresses concern and potential future risk.
The segment provides historical context/fact.
The segment describes a historical process/fact.
States the importance of detection and limiting transmission ('important to detect... as quickly as possible and make sure that we give as little opportunity as possible').
Describes the initiation of an investigation ('sparking a federal investigation') which is a response/capability.
The segment reports facts/numbers (strandings reported).
The segment reports a fact (seals found dead).
Describes an action taken ('gave the 'unusual' designation') which is a classification/reporting action, part of surveillance/response.
Describes the purpose/goal of an investigation ('authorizes a federal investigation to try to determine the cause and minimize deaths').
The segment reports findings/facts (samples tested positive).
Provides advice/recommendations for action ('ask the public not to touch', 'keep pets far away', 'call... to report') which are public health measures/safeguards.
The segment reports a fact (location of strandings).
Describes an ongoing action/collaboration ('it's working with... groups on its investigation') which is a response/capability.
Describes actions taken ('reported responding to dozens of seal strandings') which are response measures/capabilities.
The segment reports a fact (increase in strandings).
The segment reports a fact and describes impact.
Describes an ongoing effort ('Our groups are trying to catch all the reports') which is a response/surveillance capability.
The segment reports findings/facts (virus detected).
The segment reports a fact (virus affecting Canada).
The segment reports a fact (case found).
The segment reports facts/numbers (birds killed).
The segment reports facts/numbers (birds killed).
The segment describes a characteristic of the virus.
The segment expresses worry and reports a historical fact.
Describes an action taken ('added Tamiflu to the... Kit') which is a preparedness measure/capability.
Describes an action taken ('we are adding Tamiflu to the Contagion Kit') which is a preparedness measure/capability.
Describes the function/capability of a medication ('disrupts the replication', 'reduce the severity').
States possession of resources/capabilities ('we have the tools available to defend our health').
Provides advice/recommendation for action ('Never be caught without these critical drugs') which is a recommendation for personal preparedness.
Provides advice/recommendation for action ('Protect yourself and your family with the... Kit') which is a recommendation for personal preparedness.
Describes a process for obtaining a product/service related to preparedness ('doctor will confirm suitability and issue your prescription').
Provides advice/recommendation for action ('encourage everyone to buy one of these [kits] for emergencies') which is a recommendation for personal preparedness.
Describes the effectiveness of a service related to preparedness ('did an excellent job of getting this [kit] to me in a timely manner').
Provides advice/recommendation for action ('Don’t be caught unprepared') which is a recommendation for personal preparedness.
Provides advice/recommendation for action ('Order the... Kit today!') which is a recommendation for personal preparedness.
The segment describes the impact of the virus.
The segment describes the impact of the outbreak.
The segment reports facts/numbers (infections, symptoms).
The segment describes the impact of the virus (strained businesses, losses, layoffs).
The segment reports a fact (layoffs).
The segment describes the impact of the virus (disrupted traditions).
The segment expresses personal impact.
The segment expresses personal impact.
The segment reports facts/numbers (infections, herds affected).
Describes actions taken ('restrictions didn't outright ban', 'some... opted to cancel') which are response measures/safeguards.
Describes actions taken ('have made changes to try to lessen the chances') which are response measures/safeguards.
Describes an action taken ('excluded... as a precaution') which is a response measure/safeguard.
Describes actions taken ('canceled two attractions') which are response measures/safeguards.
Describes recommendations/guidance ('suggested... take steps', 'stressing testing and biosecurity measures') which are public health/agricultural safeguards/capabilities.
The segment expresses emotion/impact.
The segment expresses a future possibility.
The segment expresses uncertainty about the future.
The segment describes a problem/difficulty related to a response measure.
The segment describes the current situation/context.
The segment describes the severity of the situation and resulting problems, not the capability itself.
Explains the purpose of culling ('to prevent the risk') which describes the intent of a response measure/safeguard.
The segment describes a constraint/difficulty related to a response measure.
Describes actions being taken ('are addressing the problem by securing... or by incinerating') which are response measures/capabilities.
The segment describes a limitation in capability.
The segment describes an impact.
The segment describes an impact.
The segment describes an impact and provides supporting data.
The segment reports facts/numbers (prices).
The segment describes business responses, not public health/agricultural capabilities.
The segment reports facts/numbers (companies suspending items).
The segment describes the scope of the outbreak and its impact.
The segment reports a finding/fact (virus detected).
Describes planned actions ('are to slaughter', 'disinfect the farm to prevent the spread') which are response measures/safeguards.
The segment describes a fact and an interpretation.
Describes an action taken ('prompting the government to impose poultry flocks be kept indoors') which is a response measure/safeguard.
Describes a past action ('led the authorities to cull over 3 million ducks') which is a response measure/safeguard.
The segment describes a potential consequence of outbreaks.
The segment describes a consequence of outbreaks (raising concern) and a characteristic of the virus.
The segment describes a characteristic of the disease (how it spreads).
The segment comments on the difficulty of a measure, not stating capability itself.
The segment describes a fact (cases popping up) and a reason.
The segment reports facts/numbers (prices).
The segment reports facts/numbers (prices).
The segment reports facts/numbers (prices).
Describes actions taken ('requiring workers to shower', 'sanitizing trucks', 'investing in separate sets of tools') which are biosecurity measures/safeguards.
Describes actions taken ('have even upgraded barn ventilation', 'installed laser systems') which are biosecurity measures/safeguards.
Emphasizes the importance of a measure ('stress... biosecurity') which is a recommendation/emphasis on a safeguard/capability.
The segment reports a fact (cost of response).
The segment reports facts/numbers (damages, costs).
Attributes a comparative outcome (less costly) to applying lessons learned ('as the industry and government apply the lessons learned') which is a form of improved preparedness/response capability.
Describes a safeguard/action that can be taken ('Properly cooking poultry and eggs... will also kill any viruses') which is a public health measure/capability.
Describes a capability under development ('Bird flu vaccines are being developed') and a future possibility ('might help in the future').
The segment describes challenges/limitations related to a potential capability.
The segment expresses an opinion about the feasibility of a capability and lists reasons.
The segment reports findings/facts (cases confirmed).
The segment describes characteristics of the virus.
Describes actions taken/planned ('affected areas have been quarantined', 'birds... will be depopulated to prevent the spread') which are response measures/safeguards.
The segment reports findings/facts (cases detected, flock set to be euthanized).
Describes actions taken/planned ('birds would 'be humanely depopulated and disposed of'', 'farm had also been quarantined') which are response measures/safeguards.
The segment reports facts/numbers (outbreaks reported, birds killed).
States possession of a capability ('has the strongest AI surveillance program') and describes ongoing action ('USDA is working... to actively look for the disease').
The segment reports an expectation/prediction and reasons.
The segment describes potential consequences of outbreaks.
The segment describes a personal feeling/memory and a potential future threat.
The segment reports historical facts/numbers.
The segment describes a current event and its consequence (triggering fears) and a potential future development.
The segment expresses an opinion/assessment.
The segment provides background information/fact.
The segment provides background information/fact and a perspective.
The segment describes characteristics of the virus/outbreak.
The segment describes past behavior of the virus and current attitudes/uncertainty among scientists.
The segment describes a past action/finding, not the process as a safeguard.
The segment expresses uncertainty about the future.
Describes a past action ('was sent... to help in the investigation') which is a response/capability.
The segment reports a biographical fact.
The segment asks a question about feelings/perspective.
The segment asks questions about feelings/perspective and future implications.
The segment describes a state of mind (worry).
The segment describes states of mind (dislike, struggle to answer).
The segment provides historical context/fact.
The segment provides historical context/fact.
The segment reports facts/numbers (cases detected).
The segment reports a fact/number (deaths).
The segment expresses an opinion/assessment.
The segment expresses an opinion/assessment and worry.
The segment expresses worry and describes a consequence.
The segment expresses an opinion/assessment.
The segment reports a historical fact/assessment.
The segment reports an opinion/assessment.
The segment describes a past event/impact.
Describes a past action ('were euthanized') which is a response measure, stated factually.
The segment expresses uncertainty and possibility.
The segment describes a reaction (gives pause).
The segment reports facts/numbers ('reports 110 reports').
The segment expresses difficulty in assessment.
The segment describes a characteristic of the virus.
The segment reports a historical fact/event.
The segment reports historical findings/facts ('infections... have been detected').
The segment expresses a perspective based on past experience.
The segment reports facts/events ('were reported').
The segment expresses an opinion/assessment.
The segment describes a fact that reduces concern, not a capability/preparedness measure.
The segment describes a past event/fact.
The segment describes a past event/fact.
The segment describes a past event/fact.
The segment provides background information/fact.
The segment provides background information/fact.
The segment describes a characteristic of the virus/process.
The segment describes a state of mind (worry) and a concern.
The segment expresses a prediction about the future.
The segment expresses a prediction and uncertainty.
The segment comments on agreement among scientists.
The segment expresses an opinion/recommendation for future preparedness, not existing capability.
The segment expresses an opinion/assessment.
Describes past actions ('was involved in the investigations') which are response measures/capabilities.
The segment describes characteristics of other viruses and their past impact.
The segment reports the result of sampling, not the process as a safeguard.
The segment provides a recommendation for future preparedness, not existing capability.
The segment describes a state of mind (worry) and a concern.
The segment expresses an opinion about a hypothetical future situation and difficulty in implementing capabilities.
The segment expresses an opinion about the lack of ability/capability and a resulting feeling.
Describes a company's activity ('working to create... tests') and an action taken ('has hired... to help educate policymakers') related to capability.
The segment describes a fact (regulatory status is unclear).
Mentions components of the federal response ('emergency assistance', 'efforts to incentivize safety precautions and testing') which are response measures/capabilities.
Describes companies' activities ('working on bird flu vaccines', 'developing other therapeutics') and actions ('have all engaged Washington') related to capability.
Describes lobbying activity related to testing ('lobbying... on issues related to the virus') which is related to implementing/improving capability.
Mentions 'containment efforts' which are response measures/capabilities.
The segment lists groups involved in lobbying.

Lists lobbying priorities ('restrictions on animal transport', 'payments for farmers', 'legislation to expand a compensation program') which are proposed/desired response measures/safeguards/capabilities.

Describes lobbying activity related to prevention efforts ('lobbying on general efforts to prevent diseases') and monitoring ('legislation that would provide additional resources for monitoring') which are capabilities.
The segment reports a fact (suffered outbreaks).
The segment describes a potential consequence (shortages).
The segment reports a fact (birds culled).
The segment describes a consequence (fears about availability).
The segment describes existing options and potential future market/supply chain actions.
The segment reports a lack of response and a communication strategy.
The segment describes characteristics of the disease (how it spreads).
The segment describes characteristics of the disease (how it spreads).
Describes a standard procedure/response ('birds... are culled, with farmers compensated') which is a response measure/capability.
The segment reports facts/numbers (birds culled, wild birds died).
The segment reports a historical fact/number (ducks culled).
The segment describes a future possibility and a reason.
The segment compares current situation to past and describes a characteristic of the virus/situation.
Describes a recommendation/call for action ('has called for... housing order') which is a recommendation for a safeguard/capability.
Describes an action taken ('Veterinary trials to test bird flu vaccines have started') which is development/testing capability.
Describes a future action ('vaccines will be jointly procured') related to obtaining resources/capability.
Describes the intended use/target of a resource/capability ('doses are intended for those most exposed') which is a statement about preparedness/strategy.
The segment describes the spread and impact of the virus.
The segment states an assessment of risk ('risk... is considered to be low') which is a low-risk fact framed for reassurance.
Describes an action taken ('has already secured... doses') related to obtaining resources/capability.
The segment reports facts/numbers (cases reported).
The segment reports facts/numbers (cases reported, symptoms).
The segment reports a historical fact/event ('case... was detected').
The segment describes a risk factor.
The segment reports findings/facts (results of testing).
The segment reports a fact (results are pending).
The segment reports facts/numbers (herds reported infections).
The segment reports a fact (outbreak reported).
The segment reports facts/numbers (birds killed, slaughter).
The segment provides background information/fact.
The segment describes a characteristic of the virus (can jump).
The segment reports facts/numbers (outbreak emerged, cases confirmed).
The segment reports a fact (location/type of cases).
The segment states an assessment of risk ('It is rare') which is a low-risk fact framed for reassurance.
The segment describes risk factors and states an assessment of risk ('risk... is still negligible') which is a low-risk fact framed for reassurance.
The segment reports facts (location, contact).
